title: Sri Lanka’s state-run Litro rejects  price hike claim – official
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s state-run Litro Gas Company Ltd rejected a price increase claim that 12.5kg gas cylinder prices were increased to 5175 rupees and said there was no such decision taken yet.
Vijitha Herath, the newly appointed Chairman of Litro told EconomyNext that nothing has been decided yet.

On March 31, Litro sought approval from the cabinet to hike gas prices to sponge 4.2 billion rupee loss it had made since the rupee was floated on March 7. The rupee has fallen around 70 percent since then.
Litro officials on March 22 told EconomyNext that they had opted for a price revision as gas prices have risen following the rupee depreciation.
Litro raised the prices last in October 2021 to 2,675 rupees from 1,493 rupees.

Laugfs, the private-gas supplier that controls 20 percent of the market share increased the price of 12.5kg cylinder for the third time since August 2021 record to levels in March – raising by 48 percent or 1,359 rupees to 4,199. It raised 5kg gas cylinder price by 544 rupees to 1,680 rupees.(Colombo/April22/2022)
